question: Which country's political movement was the "Lapua Movement"?
explanation: Lapua Movement was an important political movement in Finland in which radical Finnish nationalist and anti-communist political ideology supporters grouped together and started a movement in 1929. They put forward a far-right politics and this movement got banned after the failed Mantsala Rebellion coup initiated by this movement in 1932. Patriotic People's Movement was the successor organization of the Lapua Movement, which also got banned in 1944.
